body_html: @edgarriba there's no magic bullet for matching performance of two frameworks unfortunately. Last time I tried to match Torch's l-BFGS in TensorFlow, I ended up saving results after each operation in both Torch and in TensorFlow, and comparing them numerically one-by-one until I found the difference. See SaveTensor1D and acompanying notebook

body: @edgarriba there's no magic bullet for matching performance of two frameworks unfortunately. Last time I tried to match Torch's l-BFGS in TensorFlow, I ended up saving results after each operation in both Torch and in TensorFlow, and comparing them numerically one-by-one until I found the difference. See [SaveTensor1D](https://github.com/yaroslavvb/lbfgs/blob/master/mnist_sgd.lua#L91) and acompanying [notebook]( https://github.com/yaroslavvb/lbfgs/blob/master/Porting%20Torch%20l-BFGS%20to%20immediate.ipynb)
